sen.j: 別当寺（べっとうじ）とは、神仏習合が許されていた江戸時代以前に、神社に付属して置かれた寺のこと。
sen.e: Betto-ji Temple was a Buddhist temple that was attached to a Shinto shrine when the syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism was permitted prior to the Edo period.

sen.j: 神前読経など神社の祭祀を仏式で行う者を別当（社僧ともいう）と呼んだことから、別当の居る寺を別当寺と言った。
sen.e: The name "Betto-ji Temple" arose from the betto (also known as shaso) who served these temples and conducted Shinto shrine rituals according to Buddhist practices such as the reciting of sutras in front of Shinto kami.
